intro: Diplusodon ulei var. ciliatus, commonly known as the hairy diplusodon, is a variant of the diplusodon genus, which belongs to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy or pubescent stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Its flowers are small and white or greenish, arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some historical use in traditional medicine.
